verses.verse: The song <WH7892> of songs, <WH7892> which <WH834> is Solomon's. <WH8010>
Let him kiss <WH5401> me with the kisses <WH5390> of his mouth: <WH6310> for your love <WH1730> is better <WH2896> than wine. <WH3196>

Because of the smell <WH7381> of your good <WH2896> ointments <WH8081> your name <WH8034> is as ointment <WH8081> poured <WH7324> forth, therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> do the virgins <WH5959> love <WH157> you.

Draw <WH4900> me, we will run <WH7323> after <WH310> you: the king <WH4428> has brought <WH935> me into his chambers: <WH2315> we will be glad <WH1523> and rejoice <WH8055> in you, we will remember <WH2142> your love <WH1730> more than wine: <WH3196> the upright <WH4339> love <WH157> you.
I am black, <WH7838> but comely, <WH5000> O you daughters <WH1323> of Jerusalem, <WH3389> as the tents <WH168> of Kedar, <WH6938> as the curtains <WH3407> of Solomon. <WH8010>

Look <WH7200> not on me, because I am black, <WH7840> because the sun <WH8121> has looked <WH7805> on me: my mother's <WH517> children <WH1121> were angry <WH2734> with me; they made <WH7760> me the keeper <WH5201> of the vineyards; <WH3754> but my own vineyard <WH3754> have I not kept. <WH5201>

Tell <WH5046> me, O you whom my soul <WH5315> loves, <WH157> where <WH349> you feed, <WH7462> where <WH349> you make your flock to rest <WH7257> at noon: <WH6672> for why <WH4100> should I be as one that turns <WH5844> aside <WH5844> by the flocks <WH5739> of your companions? <WH2270>

If <WH518> you know <WH3045> not, O you fairest <WH3303> among women, <WH802> go <WH3318> your way forth <WH3318> by the footsteps <WH6119> of the flock, <WH6629> and feed <WH7462> your kids <WH1423> beside <WH5921> the shepherds' <WH7462> tents. <WH4908>
I have compared <WH1819> you, O my love, <WH7474> to a company of horses <WH5484> in Pharaoh's <WH6547> chariots. <WH7393>
Your cheeks <WH3895> are comely <WH4998> with rows <WH8447> of jewels, <WH3627> your neck <WH6677> with chains <WH2737> of gold.
We will make <WH6213> you borders <WH8447> of gold <WH2091> with studs <WH5351> of silver. <WH3701>
While <WH5704> the king <WH4428> sits at his table, <WH4524> my spikenard <WH5373> sends <WH5414> forth the smell <WH7381> thereof.
A bundle <WH6872> of myrrh <WH4753> is my well-beloved <WH1730> to me; he shall lie <WH3885> all <WH3885> night between <WH996> my breasts. <WH7699>
My beloved <WH1730> is to me as a cluster <WH811> of camphire <WH3724> in the vineyards <WH3754> of Engedi. <WH5872>
Behold, <WH2009> you are fair, <WH3302> my love; <WH7474> behold, <WH2009> you are fair; <WH3302> you have doves' <WH3123> eyes. <WH5869>
Behold, <WH2009> you are fair, <WH3302> my beloved, <WH157> yes, <WH637> pleasant: <WH5273> also <WH637> our bed <WH6210> is green. <WH7488>
The beams <WH6982> of our house <WH1004> are cedar, <WH730> and our rafters <WH7351> of fir. <WH1266>
